title: The Top 10 Greatest Cat Moments In History
summary: During the 16th century, when tobacco was imported and traded as a commodity, cats were a common sight in warehouses and trading ships. Cats have adopted humans as their primary source of food for millennia, but dependence on humans for survival has made them more than just evolutionary partners. In Japan, for example, itâ€™s customary to express gratitude toward guests by serving them fish as a delicacy. The Japanese believe that the more tails a tabby has, the more fortunate and prosperous the household is.

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`So you think your cat is cute, and that\u2019s a wonderful thing. After all, cats are fluffy and adorable creatures who also happen to be natural stress relievers. But do you think your cat is cute enough to make it into the history books? Probably not. Sorry to burst your bubble, but even the cutest cat in the world would struggle to compete with some of these feline friends when it comes to making an impact on human history...
Cats have been a constant companion of humans for thousands of years. They\u2019re enigmatic creatures with a reputation for being aloof and independent; they don\u2019t ask for much and they keep very little as repayment. But cats demand something intangible from their owners: companionship. As a result, there are many famous cats in history whose exploits have become the stuff of legend\u2026`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

content.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("h2",null,"Sick-n\u2019-twisted feline antics"),mdx("p",null,`If you\u2019re a cat owner, you\u2019ve probably witnessed your furry friend exhibiting some sick-and-twisted feline antics (SAT). Cats are naturally curious and mischievous creatures, and they\u2019re often drawn to the things that humans consider dangerous. During the 16th century, when tobacco was imported and traded as a commodity, cats were a common sight in warehouses and trading ships. Somehow, they discovered a burning curiosity for tobacco, and \u2013 like a true cat \u2013 would get high by chewing on the leaves.
But tobacco was at the time a luxury item that had been drawn into the world of commerce and trade, so it was kept out of reach of human fingers. Cats, however, have been known to chew on almost anything. This led to tobacco being harvested and prepared in a way that made it more accessible to paws.`),mdx("h2",null,"Tubby Tabby enjoys a snack"),mdx("p",null,`Cats have adopted humans as their primary source of food for millennia, but this dependence on humans for survival has made them more than just evolutionary partners \u2013 it has made them a part of human culture. In Japan, for example, it\u2019s customary to express gratitude toward guests by serving them fish as a delicacy. In Japanese culture, the fish is a symbol of prosperity and growth, so it is a gift that is expected whenever someone pays a visit \u2013 even if they\u2019re just dropping by to do some business.
But the Japanese have a tradition of serving guests with a side dish of 9-tailed, 1-eyed, 2-legged, 3-souls, 4-winged, 5-coloured, 6-legged, 7-coloured, 8-winged, 9-coloured tabby cat. This is because the Japanese believe that the more tails a tabby has, the more fortunate and prosperous the household is.`),mdx("h2",null,"Persian kitty plays with a human"),mdx("p",null,`The only thing more intriguing than the history of cats is their future. It\u2019s fascinating to observe how a species that is supposed to be solitary and independent is somehow able to come together en masse and create a subculture that enables them to live among humans. Cats have been present in the United States since its earliest days, and many have become the stuff of urban legends throughout the years, especially in the context of the American dream \u2013 a dream that has become synonymous with the idea that anyone can make it.
Some cats have even been able to rise above the rest and achieve celebrity status. One of the most famous examples of this is the cat who appeared in the famous painting \u201CAmerican Gothic\u201D. The painting\u2019s subject is a man and a woman who are posed in front of a house in such a way that they appear to be holding a pitchfork and a broom, respectively, as though they are rural American farmers.`),mdx("h2",null,"The Sphinx\u2019s favorite snack"),mdx("p",null,`The Sphinx is arguably the most famous and memorable of all the statues in Egypt. It\u2019s a massive and imposing structure, one that has stood in the desert for thousands of years and has become an enduring image that is synonymous with the region. But did you know that the Sphinx isn\u2019t a statue of a human king or ruler? It\u2019s a statue of a lion.
The Sphinx is the name of both the statue and the neighbouring Giza plateau that it stands on. But the Sphinx isn\u2019t just a lion\u2019s head carved out of stone \u2013 it\u2019s also a grim reminder of one of the darker moments in feline history.
While the Sphinx has inspired countless works of art, poetry, and other creative endeavours, it is also said to be a monument to the world\u2019s first recorded serial killer.`),mdx("h2",null,"Dark Ages cat keeps the peace"),mdx("p",null,`The years between the fall of the Roman Empire and the rise of the Renaissance are often referred to as the Dark Ages because they were so lacking of creativity and innovation. This period of time was largely defined by the spread of disease, famine, and wars that caused widespread death and destruction. But some cats were able to rise above this darkness and use their powers for good.
During the Middle Ages, cats were often found on trading ships. They kept the ship free of vermin and other pests, so they were generally welcomed with open arms. When ships from England began travelling to the New World, they brought cats with them to keep the ships free from pests. The cats made their way to the New World and began to spread across the continent.`),mdx("h2",null,"fluffy feline sparked a revolution"),mdx("p",null,`Cats have been inspiring people to stand up for themselves and make a difference in the world for millennia. But it\u2019s only recently that they\u2019ve been able to share their message with a truly global audience.
During the 20th century, particularly during the 1960s, many cats began rising up against their oppressors. The original idea behind the \u201Cmake love, not war\u201D slogan was that people should stop fighting with each other and start making love instead. But cats across the world took the message to heart, and began making love with each other to make a difference.`),mdx("h2",null,"Insta-famous kitty inspires art and fashion trends"),mdx("p",null,`The world has become increasingly connected and globalized, thanks in part to the rise of social media and the internet. Cats have taken advantage of these technologies to get their message out to the world, and have inspired everything from fashion to art movements.
Some cats have even been able to turn their Insta-fame into a career as a model. The most famous cat to achieve this is the fluffy feline who inspired the \u201CLook at This Fluffy Kitty\u201D meme. While the meme was little more than a way to express boredom or frustration, it inspired thousands of other people to express their love for cats and bring attention to their importance in society.`),mdx("h2",null,"Bottom line"),mdx("p",null,`Cats have been evolving as a species for millions of years, and it\u2019s fascinating to observe the changes that have taken place along the way. While some traits have remained constant, other behaviours and characteristics have been entirely shed over time.
Cats are a social species who have been living with humans for thousands of years and have become an essential component of human society. As the human population continues to rise, it\u2019s important to remember that cats are a necessary part of our ecosystem.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Train Your Dog Not to Chew on Household Items

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:o,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:o,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Are you ready to give up chewing on household objects? How about your dog? Dogs love to chew. It\u2019s something that comes naturally for them, and there are many things you can buy or make that will help satisfy their natural instincts to chew. But as much as dogs love to have objects that they can gnaw on, it\u2019s not always safe \u2013 or advisable \u2013 to let them do it in the home. There are plenty of household items that dogs shouldn\u2019t be allowed to chew, because it could lead to potential hazards or unsanitary conditions.
Even if your dog has never chewed on inappropriate things before, a new puppy will almost certainly try out things beyond what is safe for him. How you train him from the very beginning will determine how much damage he can do if he goes after something he shouldn\u2019t. So read on and learn how to stop your dog from chewing on anything other than his own toys.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: What Are the Benefits of Mediation for Families?

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Mediation is an alternative dispute resolution process. It\u2019s a way of resolving disputes that is less adversarial than litigation and usually cheaper, faster, and more private than other methods. Mediation is also collaborative as well as neutral. The mediator acts as a neutral party who helps the parties attempt to resolve their dispute in a fair and equitable manner.
In mediation, both parties together with their respective attorneys choose from various options to settle the case outside of court. The goal of mediation is to find solutions that are agreeable to both parties. It\u2019s about finding win-win solutions instead of win-lose outcomes. It\u2019s about exploring solutions that may not have been considered had the parties not been under the guidance of a mediator who has no stake in either outcome of the dispute other than seeing it resolved amicably and fairly so that everyone walks away feeling like they have gained something from it rather than having given up something they would rather have kept.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Train Your Dog to Go to Bed

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:t,...e}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...e,components:t,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Dogs are energetic and inquisitive creatures. It\u2019s great that they want to explore the world around them and make new discoveries every day, but what isn\u2019t so great is when they keep you up at night with their shenanigans. Doggy antics like sneaking out of their kennel, chewing on shoes, digging through the trash, or getting into a fight with another dog are all signs that your pup needs more structured activities. They may be natural predators who thrive on action and excitement, but dogs also need rest to maintain their mental and physical health.
If you want to give your dog a happy and healthy life, teaching them to go to bed is an excellent first step. All dogs have instincts which tell them when it\u2019s time to rest and regenerate energy for another day out in the wild. But domesticated dogs have lost some of these instincts as a result of living in human company. Fortunately, training your dog to go to bed is fairly easy with some dedication from you!`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Train Your Dog to Leave It

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:t,...e}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...e,components:t,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Perhaps the most frustrating thing about owning a dog is that your house can never really be your own again. Fussing and fuming won\u2019t make them any less likely to follow you anywhere, or to notice that bag of chips you just carelessly threw on the table. Dogs are dogs, which means they will follow your slightest lead and chip in with their two cents at every opportunity. Sadly, this also means that it\u2019s not uncommon for dogs to get into things they shouldn\u2019t. You like peace and quiet? Not so much when there\u2019s a dog around. You like keeping your things? Good luck with that.
But luckily, with some bit of training and persistence, you can teach your pup exactly what\u2019s off limits and exactly where to leave it instead. Best of all, all these tricks take very little time and effort on our part. It doesn\u2019t have to be hard! Let\u2019s check out how!`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: The Top 10 Most Famous Cats in the World

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`When it comes to internet famous animals, cats by far come out on top. With the rise of social media, cat videos and memes have taken over the internet. There are so many funny cats online that it\u2019s almost ridiculous. These kitty clips have gained a massive following online and catapulted these lovable felines into superstardom.
Cats are a part of Internet Culture in ways that other animals just aren\u2019t. They also have unique features that make them much easier to anthropomorphize and create humorous images with. This has led to an explosion in popularity among cats of all kinds, but especially hilarious ones like Grumpy Cat, Henrietta, and Lil Bub. Now let\u2019s take a look at the Top 10 Famous Cats In The World:`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Deal with a Partner Who's Always Working

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Working too much is a problem many people struggle with \u2014 but it\u2019s even more challenging when you\u2019re in a relationship with someone who has the same work ethic. If your partner usually leaves for work before you even get out of bed, or isn\u2019t home until after you\u2019re already in bed, things can get tricky.
Working from home, flexible hours and remote working are all buzzwords in today\u2019s labor market. Companies are becoming increasingly aware that it isn\u2019t just about how much time employees spend at the desk but also about what they achieve during that time. A Gallup poll found that telecommuting or working from home is growing in popularity among professionals across most industries. Working remotely makes it easier to find jobs, negotiate schedules and live without a commute.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: The Top 10 Best Cat Breeds in the World

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Cats are mysterious creatures, it\u2019s almost impossible to know what they\u2019re thinking. But that hasn\u2019t stopped cat lovers from all over the world falling head over heels in love with these cuddly felines. Whether you like them for their beauty, intelligence or simply for their cuteness, there is no denying that cats make wonderful pets.
There are a wide range of different breeds of cat but generally speaking there are two main categories; longhaired and shorthaired cats. Within these two groups there are numerous sub-groups and hybrids with specific traits from different types of cat \u2013 check out this article to learn more about the basic types of cat!`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: From First Date to Soulmate: How to Know If You're on the Right Track

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`There are so many first date horror stories out there \u2014 awkward silences, strange amateur- magician tricks, and cringe-worthy pick-up lines being just a few of them. But getting past these awkward initial stages and finding a potential partner who you can connect with on a deeper level is no mean feat. Figuring out if someone is your soulmate or simply the first step to becoming one isn\u2019t easy. Even though it can feel like we\u2019re constantly being bombarded with images of fairy tale love and meet-cute romances, dating in real life isn\u2019t always so straightforward. Unless you\u2019re living under a rock, you probably know that letting somebody into your private world isn\u2019t something to take lightly.
But how do you know if you\u2019re on the right track when it comes to dating? Whether you\u2019ve just met someone new and want to get to know them better without rushing things or have been seeing somebody for some time and are wondering if they could be The One, here are some signs that could indicate that this person may be more than just a casual partner\u2026`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Train Your Dog Not to Jump on People

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Do you have friends who are scared of dogs? Or perhaps you just don\u2019t want your dog jumping up on people. Whatever the case, teaching your dog to not jump up on people is an essential skill. It can also be tricky because it requires reading your dog and anticipating their behavior. If they haven\u2019t jumped yet, will they leap again? Will they creep towards you first or wait for you to move closer first? The answer may be different every time and that\u2019s why it can feel like a constant guessing game. However, with persistence and patience, you can train your dog to not jump on people.
If your dog is prone to jumping, it\u2019s important to manage that behavior before moving onto this training program. Dogs commonly jump for one of three reasons: They are excited and overstimulated; they want something from you such as food or attention; or they see it as a way of getting nearer to something else (this could be either the person you don\u2019t want them leaping at or something else nearby).`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: The Top 10 Benefits of Owning a Cat

intro.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,"When it comes to the topic of cats, a lot of people tend to have preconceived ideas about what owning one entails. There is a general belief that having a cat as a pet will cut down on your social life and limit your ability to travel. While that may be true for some people, that generalization doesn\u2019t tell the whole story. Cats are fantastic pets, and if you choose the right breed, they can bring many benefits to your life. Cat ownership offers numerous positive benefits in many different areas of your life. These are just some of the reasons why you should own a cat!"))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;
